hero.headline: Designing Fluid Interfaces for Subsurface Navigation
hero.subtitle: Since 2018, we've partnered with Shell on transforming exploration workflows across 6 continents. From the North Sea to Southeast Asia, our design systems have enabled geoscientists to work more intuitively with subsurface data.

challenge.heading: The Challenge
challenge.intro: Shell's exploration teams were managing complex subsurface data across fragmented systems. Decades of accumulated technical decisions had created a fragmented ecosystem. New tools needed to integrate seamlessly while modernizing the user experience.

cards.title: Complex Workflows
cards.description: Geoscientists juggle seismic data, well logs, geological models, and interpretation tools simultaneously. Each tool had its own interaction paradigm.

cards.title: Fragmented Systems
cards.description: Decades of accumulated technical decisions had created a fragmented ecosystem. New tools needed to integrate seamlessly while modernizing the user experience.

cards.title: Extreme Environments
cards.description: From offshore platforms with intermittent connectivity to research centers with demanding display requirements, design solutions needed to work everywhere.

approach.heading: Our Approach
approach.intro: We embedded ourselves in Shell's world, visiting platforms, shadowing interpreters, and understanding the nuances of geoscience workflows before designing a single screen.

steps.title: Field Research
steps.description: On-platform observation across multiple continents. Understanding workflows in context, not conference rooms.

steps.title: User Workshops
steps.description: Collaborative sessions with geoscientists, interpreters, and operations staff to define requirements.

steps.title: Design Systems
steps.description: Creating consistency across the portfolio with scalable component libraries and interaction patterns.

steps.title: Iterative Delivery
steps.description: Usability testing with representative users. Refinement based on real-world feedback.

work.heading: The Work
work.intro: Since 2018, we've designed and refined multiple applications, each addressing different aspects of the exploration workflow.

cards.title: Fluid Data Navigation
cards.description: Intuitive interfaces for navigating subsurface data. Seamless transitions between seismic, well log, and geological model views with fluid interaction patterns.

cards.title: Collaborative Interpretation
cards.description: Multi-user workspace with fluid workflows. Real-time collaboration, version control, and annotation systems designed for distributed geoscience teams.

cards.title: Digital Field Operations
cards.description: Production digitization platform with fluid mobile experiences. Transitioning field operations from paper-based workflows to intuitive digital-first processes.

cards.title: Mobile Workbench
cards.description: Field worker mobile solution for greenfield LNG plant operations: gloved use, intermittent connectivity, safety-critical workflows.

cards.title: AI Exploration Agent
cards.description: Next-generation agentic experience design. Human-AI collaboration for geological interpretation and decision support.

cards.title: Design System
cards.description: Unified component library ensuring visual and interaction consistency across the entire exploration tool portfolio.

results.heading: Results
results.intro: Our partnership has delivered tangible improvements across Shell's exploration operations, from individual productivity gains to portfolio-wide efficiency.

metrics.label: Faster Interpretation Time
metrics.description: Geoscientists can now interpret seismic data 40% faster using the new interface paradigms.

metrics.label: Continents + Growth
metrics.description: Started in 2 regions, now deployed across 6 continents with ongoing expansion.

metrics.label: User Satisfaction
metrics.description: Post-deployment surveys show 98% satisfaction with the new interpretation tools.

metrics.label: Applications Built
metrics.description: Portfolio of exploration tools, all using consistent design patterns and components.
